channel.title: EA downloader
channel.description:
I'm not a big fan of EA. But i love Battlefield 2, its just something that I love to sit down and play after a stressful day.
Anyways(u guys notice i say this nearly every paragraph) to the point: I installed Battlefield 2 [Disk] then Battlefield 2 : Special Forces [Disk] then Battlefield 2 : Euro Force [EA downloader] finally Battlefield 2 : Armored Fury [EA downloader]
As you can see I have 2 disks, then ordered the other two online (I bought them ages ago)
Next I remember that I put in the invalid CD key (Ok aimbots don't get me anywhere, i found that out nearly two years ago) luckily a special friend gave me an old cd key generously. So i thought ok: I'll uninstall everything and re install it all just to make sure its all ok.
Now I managed to install the first two games which are on disk... then I get to the downloaded ones, there is nowhere where you can click "Un-install". Even if I boot up battlefield and try to play a map from the Downloaded addons, they appear but when you click them I get the message "You must have bought and installed this map to play it".
I decided to completely remove all files from the EA downloader and start download the files again, both of them are about 700mb. Once they downloaded they just said "Installed" so that shows they are already installed.
I've looked everywhere for a way to "Un isntall" the addons, but i can't find it anywhere.
So finally I come to mopars hoping a passer by can help me out.
Thanks in advance guys.

item.title: EA downloader
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Am I that special generous friend? <33333
'Cause that was a new CD Key <33

BTW, you have to call EA’s tech support to have them activate Euro Force and Armored Fury, cause the online activation doesn’t work.

Also, the reason that you can’t “Uninstall” EU and AF, is because it merges it with Regular BF (remember these are boosters, not expansion packs)

Read full topic

item.title: EA downloader
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Use a Registry Cleaner.

Read full topic

item.title: EA downloader
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Well I thought I did delete them manually, but obviously they are still there, I checked all the folders that they would be in. And I don’t know how to remove it from registry.

Read full topic

item.title: EA downloader
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

delete them manually and remove the registry key.

Read full topic

then

finally

As you can see I have 2 disks, then ordered the other two online (I bought them ages ago)

I’ve looked everywhere for a way to “Un isntall” the addons, but i can’t find it anywhere.
